modules.description: This module provides a `set` function to configure socket options for IPv6 multicast sockets, specifically controlling parameters like interface, hop limit, and membership. It operates on socket values paired with domain and type parameters, along with a socket option value. Use it to fine-tune multicast behavior, such as setting the outgoing interface or adjusting time-to-live for multicast packets.

This module provides functions to create and manage IPv6 multicast sockets using the Lwt concurrency library. It supports operations for sending and receiving multicast datagrams, including joining and leaving multicast groups. The module works with IPv6 addresses and sockets configured for multicast communication, enabling applications like network discovery and distributed systems coordination.

This module implements IPv6 multicast communication with Lwt-based socket operations for sending, receiving, and managing multicast group membership. It works with IPv6 sockets, addresses, and Cstruct or Bytes buffers for packet transmission and reception. Concrete use cases include implementing multicast-based service discovery, real-time group communication, and distributed event notification systems over IPv6 networks.
